page.title: 05 LANDUSE OF GREAT PARK FARM
page.content: It is a mixed farm.The CROPS grown this year are:cereals 150 hectares(ha) (Wheat 100-barley 50)cashcrops;potatoes cashcrop 16(ha); maize 6(ha)and the rest is mostly permanent and temporary pasture,used mostly for silage and hay. There was much area taken up by BUILDINGS.A converted aircraft hanger was used for storing machinery and the sheep used it during the lambing season.Potatoes and cereals are stored in a building which has ducts under the floor through which air can be blown to keep the produce dry and stop it rotting. At one time the farm was one of Europe's leading poultry producers;the sheds remain,but few birds are now kept. HOUSING includes the family home(200 years old) and labourers tied COTTAGES.(M.Sewell,P.Blake)
